SENT.plain: We present a case of a 61-year-old woman who underwent endoscopic mucosal resection (EMR) for early-stage colorectal cancer
However, because the condition of the horizontal margin of the resected tumor was unknown, she further underwent local transanal excision
Lower gastrointestinal endoscopy performed 1 year later showed protruding lesions both on the scar tissue and in the vicinity
She then underwent laparoscopic abdominoperineal resection and colostomy
This was an extremely rare case of adenocarcinoma complicated by malignant melanoma after resection
